name: Berkeley Oceanfront Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel, though beautiful, had more issues than any other establishment I have stayed previously. The hotel was constantly working on renovating two of the three elevators over the weekend, creating loud noises heard up to the seventh floor of the building. The elevators smelled of marijuana and were very slow in responding. Also, the room temperatures were above eighty with the windows open. The building has only one HVAC unit that does not allow for you to control the temperature of the room. When speaking with management, they were not only unsympathetic, they were simply rude.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Huge hotel. We were there in the low season.. so only around 10 rooms were occupied. This created somewhat of a 'Shining' atmosphere. The whole town felt like it was in the twilight-zone, which was not unpleasant. Great location next to the beach. Very large and renovated rooms (ours had ocean view). Room was clean. Breakfast was extremely minimalistic, but that was probably due to very low occupation-rate. Perfect place for recovering. Probably completely different in summer. Read some very negative reviews, but that is not necessary. Great value for money.. and a 1 minute walk from the carpark to the front of the hotel won't kill you.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: I have had friends staying at the Berkely before and I've therefore heard all the horror stories from the past about strange noises and break mark on the doors. Then I heard they renovated the hotel and would be like any other hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing room

reviews.text: When me and my friends arrived we first saw the rather boring building, but then entered the lobby. It wasn't huge, but widespread and nice. At check-in we were upgraded to a nicer room (due to availability, however it must have been PLENTY of availability because we barely saw any other guests) - but of course we were happy.
reviews.title: Horrific Hotel At The Perfect Spot
Creepy cool hotel
reviews.text: The room we came to was just astonishing. After hearing some horror stories about some of the rooms I was thrown back from what I saw. A newly renovated spacious and clean room, with beautiful interior design, big beds, ocean view and a large flat tv.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked a room at the Berkeley in early October 2009 for a stay in December 2009 on the night of a concert taking place across the street at Convention Hall. Our original booking was for a base rate of $119.00 and a total of $133.28. Upon check-in at 2 p.m. on the day of our stay, the line for check-in was 40+ minutes long because the hotel was sold out and guests started to arrive. Later we witnessed a check-in line that was an hour+. When we finally reached the desk, they handed us a hotel registration form with a rate of $278.00. We said absolutely not. As it turned out we didn't bring our print-out for the reservation (a big mistake) so they were trying to price gouge us. I indicated that I would drive to Fedex Kinkos to print it out and bring it back but the manager said she would check into it. She went into the back room for a while and came back and apologized and said they had a computer glitch and it was an error. So they ended up giving us the original rate. I also tried to use their business services and swiped my debit card to activate the computer but the mouse didn't work. The machine was charging my card for minutes online but I couldn't even use it. We had to ask the manager to unplug it to stop it from charging me. Before we left the desk, the clerk handed us a piece of paper to sign that indicated that we would not have parties in the room, smoke in the hotel, or have illegal narcotics in our rooms. I've never been more insulted. I'm not even sure if that's legal to do to hotel guests. I never in my life have experienced such treatment. We also booked a room with the capacity for 4 guests as we had another couple staying with us. The hotel informed us that it would be an extra $20 per person to be in the room beyond the first person. I'm wondering how many people book hotel rooms for 1 person? Ridiculous. If the hotel room has the capacity for 4 guests, then why would you have to pay an additional fee per person beyond 1 guest? It doesn't make any sense. Again, more price gouging. I intend to file a complaint with the BBB and Attorney General. My wife and I are in our mid 30s. I'm wondering if the hotel would treat guests in their mid 50s or 60s in the same manner. This is clearly discrimination. The hotel also made all guests wear wristbands and informed us that no unregistered guests of any kind would be allowed to enter the hotel no matter what. All guests had to show a wristband. What???? I've never heard of such a thing in my life and I travel quite a bit. I have a close friend that works in the hotel business doing bookings and she informed me that she has never heard of such practices before and she seems to think that these things are bordering on illegal. Certainly the price gouging is. I heard from several other guests that day that the hotel refused to give them their original reservation rate and rather charged them the $278/night rate which is obscene considering when I booked my room the hotel was charging $119, which then quickly went up to $165 in the weeks following culminating with the $278 rate. It's unbelievable because if that concert had not been going on across the street the Berkeley would have been completely empty. What a way to treat guests. To top it off while we were checking in, the police arrived outside and threatened to tow cars from the entrance way even though guests still needed to unload their belongings. The hotel announced that everyone must park their cars elsewhere. Talk about a complete lack of guest services. I would never stay at this hotel again. Talk about biting the hand that feeds you, this hotel takes the cake for bottom of the barrel service and they excel at mistreating guests. As an avid traveler and professional I would recommend staying elsewhere if you ever have any reason to even go to Asbury Park, NJ.
reviews.title: Terrible Treatment, Unethical, and Probably Illegal

reviews.text: I was delighted from the moment I pulled up. This hotel had it all - architectural design, elegant interior, large stunning room and most important - friendly staff. Everything you need for a "home away from home" This hotel will be on my list for future travel to the area.
reviews.title: The place to stay is The Berkeley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions when coming to Asbury for concerts etc.. They are in my opinion the only place to stay in Asbury Park. The hotel is recently renovated and the color scheme is a little odd but it adds to the entertainment of the evening. It is within walking distance of the Stone Pony and the Wonder Bar. While the parking situation could use some re-thinking and I do wish they had a restaurant on premises or room service of some kind, that would really bump it up to a four star hotel in my opinion. All the same pool is great in the summer and the staff were friendly and helpful, when we needed to heat up food the gave us access to a microwave behind the desk and let us go back and look for a phone we lost shortly after, they were prompt in changing a blown lightbulb and at check out in the morning the front desk staff was incredibly pleasant. The beds are roomy and really soft the towels are soft as well and there are heat lamps to warm up the bathroom during showers.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great price

reviews.text: We had a ridiculously low rate from Travelzoo so our expectations weren't high, but we ended up having a great overnight stay. The hotel is really neat-take a walk around and explore a little.The front desk staff was friendly, our room had a boutique hotel feel and was well appointed(great bathroom with big towels and spa toiletries), and the ocean view from the room was really nice. The location can't be beat. A really short walk down the boardwalk takes you to a bunch of good restaurants/lounges. In the morning(after the very simple continental breakfast) we requested and were easily granted a later checkout of noon and walked down the boardwalk to stroll around Ocean Grove.
reviews.title: Great off season weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been undergoing major renovations in the past few years. It has come a long way, but is not there yet. Still lacking on the customer service end, too. Make sure to request a room with an ocean view for a pleasanter stay, as the ocean, a stone's throw away, is still this place's best asset.
reviews.title: Still trying, but not there yet

reviews.text: Staff was indifferent, hallways were dark, not all elevators were in service, room was humid and sheets were actually wet from the humidity. The outlet in the bathroom didnt work so we couldnt blowdry our hair in preparation for wedding events. Had to hook up dryer to extension cord in room that didnt reach the mirror. The maintenance man said he would fix it and then told us he was too busy. The "ocean view" could not be seen through the filthy window. You had to step over the toilet to get into the shower. Insufficient parking resulted in having to park at meters and pay until 9pm. The hotel's small parking lot was a city block's walk from the hotel and my 89 year old father had to walk it in the heat when he parked his car before we arrived. The bagels at the breakfast were stale and the area where the breakfast was held was dark and unappetizing. We came from out of state for a wedding and realized that the hotel is always booked with wedding guests who stay there because of the reception. The reception was held in a beautiful room, but there was a lack of airconditioning, so people forced open windows and everyone was perspiring and uncomfortable. Long lines in lobby and a lot of grumbling and complaining from dissatisfied guests. I paid $166 per night so please don't tell me not to expect perfection...I expected service and comfort, but received neither. I will never return.
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the berkley on hotels.com and the site for the the hotel was very misleading. Other then the ONE lady melissa the staff were rude and very unhelpful,i didnt feel comfortable in the least bit,i wanted out as soon as possible my fiance and i spent the least amout of time possible in the room, we had two rooms the first room the floor was soaked then proceded to tell the front desk and when we returned our door was wide open with all of our belongings sitting out in the open for anyone to come in and take. I myself have stayed at many hotels along the new jersey shore,and have always had a great time and felt relaxed enough as if i were at home,which is the way u should feel when ON VACATION!,I will NEVER recomend this "hotel" to anyone and will NEVER stay there again! i wouldnt advise it to anyone who is looking for a nice relaxing vacation.
reviews.title: The Worst Stay I've EVER Experienced!!!

reviews.text: I don't even know where to start when it comes to the Berkeley. First of all Asbury park is freaky enough..we all felt like we were in the movie Silent Hill. When you pull up to the hotel you feel like your entering a psychiatric hospital. Even though the inside looks brand new you get this weird feeling from the minute you enter the hotel. Especially since its so huge but has such few guest. We all thought the elevator was going to collapse and literally held on to each other. Around 1am we heard people outside our door..so my fiance tried to open the door to get in the hall and someone was literally holding it from the other side. He struggled for several minutes..finally got the door open..and no one was there. Even though we shut off one of the lamps by the switch it was still flickering until we unplugged it altogether. Our whole group was so scared that we didn't even fall asleep until 3am. Then we woke up early..got our stuff together in about 10 minutes and headed for Seaside Heights. I would never go back to this hotel or Asbury Park again.
reviews.title: Haunted!

reviews.text: Our family booked this hotel because it was in walking distance of Ocean Grove and we were attending an event there. With 2 children, I didn't think the quaint bed n breakfasts in Ocean Grove were appropriate for us. I opted to go to the BERKELEY in Asbury park because it was basically the only hotel in AP. There is 1 other but is very run down. Apon arriving we did notice a few girl/girl couples but by evening, the entire hotel was swarming with thousands of these couples. I am not a pedujice person but it got very annoying when we realized we were the ONLY family there! girl girl/ boy/boy couples came in by the bus load. They have weekend conventions and the BERKELEY is there home base hotel. The group is called "divas on the beach" and if you go to their site you can see this hotel listed as their place. If they were quiet and kept to themselves, we would have been fine but, they had a huge party ALL NIGHT Fri. & Sat. night. Thumping music, screaming, drunk girls (dressed very inappropriate for my young kids to see), groping each other, wrestling in the hallways at 3 am. VERY LOUD!!! My family got NO sleep. The hotel was completely booked (not with families!) Thats all 8 floors!! We had nowhere to go & the hotel will not credit me a dime! Do not go to this hotel unless you are good with this kind of life style!! As a matter of fact, that goes for the entire town of Asbury Parks! (including the beaches) We felt very "out of place" as a family. Its a shame this town has ended up like this. In addition to this MAJOR problem. The Hotel had no parking of there own, we had to pay more than $20 per day for metered street parking!! Also the "free breakfast".....stale beagels and sucky coffee. OMG..This trip SUCKED!!
reviews.title: Not for Families!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After my fiance and I were on the beach all day, we came back to our hotel room and I found my wallet was open in my purse and I checked because that was weird and come to find out money was missing. We had to report this to the manager, get the police involved, it was just a nightmare. Who wants to do all that on their vacation?! I am very upset still about what happened. I will not be returning to this hotel. Other things to watch out for if you stay here, the parking is horrible. You have to walk all the way around the hotel to get back and forth from your car and there is only one small free parking area where guests park. On the weekend, it got really busy and we couldn't find a spot to park. It was really annoying. I didn't have a good time staying there. I would not reccommend this hotel. The view of the ocean was beautiful and the deal we got was great, but that was about it.
reviews.title: Don't trust the maids, they steal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd never been to Asbury Park or the Berkeley, but based on our experience we'll return to both.
reviews.title: Unique, comfortable & conveniently located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is an interesting combination of new &ol old: it's an old hotel with renovated surfaces & furnishings. The history makes it both charming & eerie. In a good way.
reviews.title: No Problems at All

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many nooks & crannies to explore. Fks like the Rat Pack stayed here in its heyday. Johnny Cash lived here with his family in the 90s. If you like history & rock n roll, this place is for you.
reviews.title: Not as bad as everyone thinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well-appointed: nice linens, huge bathroom, new furnishings. Very clean.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Customer service was fine, though they seemed a little overwhelmed. They were polite & even let us store our bags (for free) so we could hit up the Pinball Museum after we checked out.
reviews.title: Okay Trip - if getting a good deal - might stay here again

description: As historic Asbury Park’s premier boutique hotel, The Berkeley Oceanfront Hotel enjoys a prime location along the New Jersey shoreline just steps from the famed boardwalk. Designed by noted Beaux Arts architect Warren Whitney of New York, the hotel recently underwent a renovation of historic proportions and is poised to experience the renaissance of this nineteenth-century seaside destination. Modern luxuries complement the classic grandeur of this 238-room famous hotel, with a nod to the Victorian architecture and oceanfront glamour of Asbury Park’s storied past. The Berkeley Oceanfront Hotel embodies everything that is the revitalization of the famed Jersey Shore and itself represents the rebirth of this cultural icon.
